TSE (libsoni.core.tse)ÔÉÅ

libsoni.core.tse.sonify_tse_clicks(time_positions: ndarray | None = None, click_pitch: int = 69, click_fading_duration: float = 0.25, click_amplitude: float = 1.0, offset_relative: float = 0.0, sonification_duration: int | None = None, fading_duration: float = 0.05, normalize: bool = True, fs: int = 22050) → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ

Sonifies array of time positions with clicks.

Parameters:

  • time_positions (np.ndarray (np.float32 / np.float64) [shape=(N, )]) ‚Äì Array with time positions for clicks.

  • click_pitch (int, default = 69) ‚Äì Pitch for click signal.

  • click_fading_duration (float, default = 0.25) ‚Äì Fading duration for click signal, in seconds

  • click_amplitude (float, default = 1.0) ‚Äì Amplitude for click signal.

  • offset_relative (float, default = 0.0) ‚Äì Relative offset for the beginning of a click. 0 indicates that the beginning of the click event is at the time position, 1 indicates the ending of the click event corresponds to the time position.

  • sonification_duration (int, default = None) ‚Äì Determines duration of sonification, in samples.

  • fading_duration (float, default = 0.05) ‚Äì Determines duration of fade-in and fade-out at beginning and end of the sonification, in seconds.

  • normalize (bool, default = True) ‚Äì Determines if output signal is max-normalized to [-1,1].

  • fs (int, default = 22050) ‚Äì Sampling rate, in samples per seconds.

Returns:

tse_sonification (np.ndarray (np.float32 / np.float64) [shape=(M, )]) ‚Äì Sonified time positions.

libsoni.core.tse.sonify_tse_multiple_clicks(times_pitches: List[Tuple[ndarray, int]] | None = None, click_fading_duration: float = 0.25, click_amplitude: float = 1.0, offset_relative: float = 0.0, sonification_duration: int | None = None, fading_duration: float = 0.05, normalize: bool = True, fs: int = 22050) → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ

Given multiple arrays in form of a list, this function creates the sonification of different sources.

Parameters:

  • times_pitches (List[Tuple[np.ndarray, int]]) ‚Äì List of tuples comprising the time positions and pitches of the clicks

  • sonification_duration (int, default = None) ‚Äì Duration of the output waveform, given in samples.

  • click_fading_duration (float, default = 0.25) ‚Äì Duration for click signal.

  • click_amplitude (float, default = 1.0) ‚Äì Amplitude for click signal.

  • offset_relative (float, default = 0.0) ‚Äì Relative offset coefficient for the beginning of the given audio sample. 0 indicates that the beginning of the sample is at the time position. 1 indicates the ending of the sample corresponding to the time position.

  • sonification_duration (int, default = None) ‚Äì Determines duration of sonification, in samples.

  • fading_duration (float, default = 0.05) ‚Äì Determines duration of fade-in and fade-out at beginning and end of the sonification, in seconds.

  • normalize (bool, default = True) ‚Äì Determines if output signal is max-normalized to [-1,1].

  • fs (int, default = 22050) ‚Äì Sampling rate, in samples per seconds.

Returns:

tse_sonification (np.ndarray (np.float32 / np.float64) [shape=(M, )]) ‚Äì Sonified time positions.

libsoni.core.tse.sonify_tse_multiple_samples(times_samples: List[Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]] | None = None, offset_relative: float = 0.0, sonification_duration: int | None = None, fading_duration: float = 0.05, normalize: bool = True, fs: int = 22050) → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ

Given multiple arrays in form of a list, this function creates the sonification of different sources.

Parameters:

  • times_samples (List[Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]]) ‚Äì List of tuples comprising the time positions and samples

  • offset_relative (float, default = 0.0) ‚Äì Relative offset coefficient for the beginning of the given audio sample. 0 indicates that the beginning of the sample is at the time position. 1 indicates the ending of the sample corresponding to the time position.

  • sonification_duration (int, default = None) ‚Äì Determines duration of sonification, in samples.

  • fading_duration (float, default = 0.05) ‚Äì Determines duration of fade-in and fade-out at beginning and end of the sonification, in seconds.

  • normalize (bool, default = True) ‚Äì Determines if output signal is max-normalized to [-1,1].

  • fs (int, default = 22050) ‚Äì Sampling rate, in samples per seconds.

Returns:

tse_sonification (np.ndarray (np.float32 / np.float64) [shape=(M, )]) ‚Äì Sonified waveform in form of a 1D Numpy array.

libsoni.core.tse.sonify_tse_sample(time_positions: ndarray | None = None, sample: ndarray | None = None, offset_relative: float = 0.0, sonification_duration: int | None = None, fading_duration: float = 0.05, normalize: bool = True, fs: int = 22050) → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ

Sonifies time positions with warped versions of a custom sample (e.g., metronome sounds).

Parameters:

  • time_positions (np.ndarray (np.float32 / np.float64) [shape=(N, )]) ‚Äì Array with time positions for clicks.

  • sample (np.ndarray (np.float32 / np.float64) [shape=(K, )]) ‚Äì Sample to be used.

  • offset_relative (float, default = 0.0) ‚Äì Relative offset coefficient for the beginning of a click. 0 indicates that the beginning of the click event is at the time position. 1 indicates the ending of the click event corresponds to the time position.

  • sonification_duration (int, default = None) ‚Äì Determines duration of sonification, in samples.

  • fading_duration (float, default = 0.05) ‚Äì Determines duration of fade-in and fade-out at beginning and end of the sonification, in seconds.

  • normalize (bool, default = True) ‚Äì Determines if output signal is max-normalized to [-1,1].

  • fs (int, default = 22050) ‚Äì Sampling rate, in samples per seconds.

Returns:

tse_sonification (np.ndarray (np.float32 / np.float64) [shape=(M, )]) ‚Äì Sonified time positions.
